qas.question: What are literary and colloquial readings called?
What is another name for colloquial?
Literary readings are usually used where?
colloquial reading are usually used where?
What is another term for philosophical concepts that are prominent in Hokkien dialects as well as Sinitic varieties?
What are Sinitic and philosophical concepts called?
To what standard are Hokken dialects similar to?

plausible_answers.text: The existence of literary and colloquial readings

qas.question: What is a prominent feature of the Tang standard and also in Sinitic varieties?

plausible_answers.text: pronunciations of the vernacular during the Tang Dynasty

qas.question: What are the bulk of surnames based on?

context: <b7_0>The existence of literary and colloquial readings<b7_0/> (文白異讀), called <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>tha̍k-im<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> (讀音), is a prominent feature of some Hokkien dialects and indeed in many Sinitic varieties in the south. The bulk of literary readings (文讀, bûn-tha̍k), based on <b8_0>pronunciations of the vernacular during the Tang Dynasty<b8_0/>, are mainly used in <a2_0>formal phrases and written language<a2_0/> (e.g. philosophical concepts, surnames, and some place names), while the colloquial (or <a1_0>vernacular)<a1_0/> ones (白讀, pe̍h-tha̍k) are basically used in <a3_0>spoken language and vulgar phrases<a3_0/>. Literary readings are more similar to the pronunciations of the <b6_0>Tang standard of Middle Chinese<b6_0/> than their colloquial equivalents.
